title: BRCA1
summary: Breast cancer type 1 susceptibility protein is a protein that in humans is encoded by the BRCA1  (/ˌbrækəˈwʌn/) gene.[5] Orthologs are common in other vertebrate species, whereas invertebrate genomes may encode a more distantly related gene.[6] BRCA1 is a human tumor suppressor gene[7][8] (also known as a caretaker gene) and is responsible for repairing DNA.[9]
